Key Match Events: Pakistan kept their slim Twenty20 World Cup hopes alive with a 33-run win over South Africa in a dramatic rain-affected match at the Sydney Cricket Ground on November 3, 2022.
Iftikhar Ahmed and Shadab Khan rescued Pakistan with the bat with a superb 82-run partnership.
Iftikhar Ahmed scored 51 off 35 balls and Shadab Khan blazed 52 from 22 as Pakistan finished their innings at 185-9.
Shaheen Afridi removed Quinton de Kock for a duck and Rilee Rossouw for seven, leaving South Africa 16-2.
Shadab Khan changed the game in his first over, having Temba Bavuma caught behind and then bowling Aiden Markram, leaving South Africa 66-4.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was rain-affected, leading to South Africa's target being adjusted to 142 runs, needing 73 runs in five overs.
South Africa finished on 108-9 at the end of the match.
